conclusion: Determine the refractive index of the glass column.
The glass column has a quarter-circle cross-section with radius R.
Distances given are PD = (sqrt(3)R)/2 and MC = (sqrt(3)R)/3.
Light enters from point P and hits the interface BC at point M.
Calculate angle of incidence i using cos(i) = PD/R = sqrt(3)/2, hence i = 30 degrees.
Calculate angle of refraction r using cos(r) = MC/R = sqrt(3)/3, hence r = 60 degrees.
Snell's Law relates angles of incidence and refraction to refractive index n.
Apply Snell's Law: n sin(30 degrees) = sin(60 degrees).
Solve for n: n x 1/2 = sqrt(3)/2, hence n = sqrt(3).
The refractive index of the glass column is sqrt(3).
